title: Business & Finance
text:
An NLRB official tossed out results from an Amazon unionization vote for warehouse workers in Alabama, saying that the company has violated labor law in its campaign against organizing.

---

The pandemic has unleashed a historic burst in entrepreneurship and self-employment.

---

Stocks and oil prices bounced back from Friday's selloff as investors' fears over the Omicron variant eased. The S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq rose 1.3%, 0.7% and 1.9%, respectively.

---

Microsoft CEO Nadella sold about half of his shares in the company last week.

---

Elizabeth Holmes testified at her trial that she had been raped while studying at Stanford and not long after entered into an abusive relationship with the man who would become her top deputy at Theranos.

---

Hertz plans to buy back as much as $2 billion of its stock, returning more capital to investors who stood by the car-rental company through its bankruptcy filing last year.

---

The FTC is seeking information from Amazon, P&G, Walmart and others on how they handle supply-chain snarls as it studies whether the problems have led to anticompetitive behavior.
